title: Pachuca edge Al Ahly to face Real Madrid in FIFA Intercontinental final
body_text:
Pachuca edge Al Ahly to face Real Madrid in FIFA Intercontinental final
The Mexican side now prepare for a monumental challenge in the final at Lusail Stadium.
Pachuca clinched a dramatic 6-5 victory on penalties against Al Ahly after a goalless 120 minutes to advance to the 2024 Intercontinental Cup final.
The tense semi-final unfolded at the 974 Stadium in Doha, where both sides showcased resilience but failed to find the net during regular and extra time.
The match was an evenly contested battle, with Pachuca relying on their swift attacking play and Al Ahly demonstrating defensive solidity.
Despite numerous chances, the deadlock persisted, forcing the game into a penalty shootout.
In the decisive shootout, Pachuca displayed nerves of steel, converting six penalties to Al Ahly’s five. Carlos Moreno, Pachuca’s goalkeeper, emerged as the hero by saving the crucial penalty that secured the Mexican side’s place in the final.
With this victory, Pachuca now look ahead to a historic challenge against Real Madrid on December 18 at the Lusail Stadium in Doha.
The Mexican team will aim to make history by toppling the 14-time UEFA Champions League winners and lifting the prestigious title.
The final promises to be a captivating encounter as Pachuca, a rising force in international football, seeks to expand their legacy against one of the sport's most decorated teams.
